blockquote.p: Requires: The expression dynamic_cast<T*>((U*)nullptr) shall be well formed and shall have well defined behavior.

discussion.p: A dynamic_cast of a null pointer, if well-formed, always has well-defined behavior: it returns a null pointer. The second part is therefore redundant as currently worded. The C++14 version, on the other hand, requires dynamic_cast<T*>(r.get()) to have well-defined behavior, which actually adds something: it requires the user to not trigger the undefined case in [class.cdtor]/5, for instance.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4659.

blockquote.p:
-4- Requires: The expression dynamic_cast<T*>((U*)0) shall be well formed. The expression dynamic_cast<typename shared_ptr<T>::element_type*>(r.get()) shall be well formed and shall have well defined behavior.
